segments.text: I'm a Bizar Masavi, a third year computer science student at Mukesh Patel School of Technology
Management and Engineering, NMIMS Mumbai.
I'm excited about the opportunity to join the Education News Alliance, three week virtual
internship this July.
Why this internship?
Well, with a background in FinTech and a strong curiosity to explore its global applications,
I am eager to gain hands-on experience with New Zealand's dynamic business environment.
Collaborating in diverse teams to tackle real world challenges aligns perfectly with
mass aspirations.
Recently, I led a team of three to develop a data-driven Zomato business analytics dashboard.
We balanced our academic commitments while coordinating effectively to meet project milestones.
This experience mirrors the 10 to 15 hours COVID commitment expected in this internship.
My proficiency in Python, SQL, Power BI, First-Tack Web Development, Gen AI and many more,
it is a continuous learning process.
Equips me to contribute meaningfully from the outset.
I deeply value professional mentorship during our dashboard project guidance from our faculty
mentor was instrumental in refining our scope and un-sing stakeholder communication.
I look forward to learning from my E and C mentor and engaging in constructive peer feedback.
I've explored in New Zealand's collaborative work culture which emphasizes egalitarianism
and values diverse perspectives.
My final presentation in July, my goal is to deliver actionable insights that reflect
these principles and contribute tangible value.
Thank you for considering my application.
I'm enthusiastic about bringing my technical skills, collaborative spirit and passion for
learning to this virtual internship.
Namaste.
